questions.text: The following plate shows H. influenzae colonies. Which of the following is responsible for the phenomenon shown?

A 23-year-old female presents with fever and altered sensorium for two days with rashes on legs as shown. Her BP is 70/50 mm Hg and neck stiffness is present. Lumbar puncture reveals cloudy CSF with 4200 cells/µL, protein level 198 and glucose 21 mg/ dL. Which of the following correctly describes the organism causing this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Gram negative diplococci (kidney shaped), oxidase positive

options.label: B
options.text: Gram negative diplococci, ferments glucose and maltose

options.label: C
options.text: Gram positive cocci catalase negative, bacitracin sensitive

options.label: D
options.text: Gram positive diplococci (lanceolate), catalase negative, optochin sensitive

questions.correct_answer: B. Gram negative diplococci, ferments glucose and maltose
questions.explanation: Ans.B) Gram negative diplococci, ferments glucose and maltose

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true about Trichomonas vaginalis?

options.label: B
options.text: Twitching motility is seen on wet saline mount

options.label: C
options.text: Cysts are seen on wet saline mount of vaginal secretions

options.label: D
options.text: It is not a sexually transmitted infection

questions.correct_answer: B. Twitching motility is seen on wet saline mount

questions.text: What is correct about the schematic image of Salmonella typhi?

options.label: A
options.text: A = H antigen, B = Vi antigen, C = O antigen

options.label: B
options.text: A = Vi antigen, B = H antigen, C = O antigen

options.label: C
options.text: A = H antigen, B = O antigen, C = Vi antigen

options.label: D
options.text: A = O antigen, B = Vi antigen, C = H antigen

questions.correct_answer: A. A = H antigen, B = Vi antigen, C = O antigen

questions.text: A lady from West Bengal presented with an ulcer surrounded by erythema on the right leg. Microscopy of the biopsy from the edge of the ulcer showed organisms with dark staining nuclei and kinetoplast. What is the most likely causative agent?
Infection with Clonorchis sinensis is associated with an increased risk of?

A patient presented with complaints of persistent cough and weight loss. He had a history of contact with multiple sexual partners. He was diagnosed as HIV positive 6 months back and is poorly adherent to his medications. The fungal culture of sputum was negative. On Gomori methamine silver staining, the cells showed darkly stained crescent-shaped cysts. What is the most likely causative organism?
Which of the following laboratory test is used to diagnose rotavirus diarrhea?

options.label: A
options.text: Antigen detection in the stool sample

questions.correct_answer: A. Antigen detection in the stool sample
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Antigen detection in the stool sample

questions.text: A boy presented with a fever and chills. Rapid test was positive for specific antigen HRP-2. Which of the following species of Plasmodium is the most likely causative agent?

A child was brought with complaints of high fever, multiple seizures, headache, and neck rigidity. CSF analysis showed low glucose, high protein, and many polymorphs. The CSF culture showed pleomorphic gram-negative bacilli. What is true about the causative organism?

options.label: B
options.text: Produces non-lactose fermenting colonies on MacConkey agar

options.label: C
options.text: Exhibits satellitism around Staphylococcus aureus colonies

options.label: D
options.text: It exhibits alpha hemolysis on sheep blood agar

questions.correct_answer: C. Exhibits satellitism around Staphylococcus aureus colonies

questions.text: A man presents with a history of dysuria and urethral discharge after having unprotected sexual intercourse. Gram-staining of the purulent discharge is seen in the following image. What is the treatment of choice for this infection?

A patient addressing from Delhi presents with fever, arthralgia, and extensive petechial rash for 3 days. Lab investigations revealed a hemoglobin of 9 g/dL, a white blood cell count of 9000 cells/mm3, a platelet count of 20000 cells/mm3, and a prolonged bleeding time. The clotting time was normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A militant presents with rashes all over his body sparing the palms and soles. On examination, he was febrile and lice were noted. Which of the following is responsible for his condition?
Microfilariae with sheathed tail and two nuclei at the tail tip is suggestive of?

A patient presents with itching in the axilla. On microscopic examination of the skin scrapings, a red pigment-producing fungus with pencil-shaped macroconidia is seen. Which of the following is the most likely organism?
Which of the following is considered to be the best for the detection of Clostridium difficile?
questions.correct_answer: B. Glutamate dehydrogenase and toxin assay

questions.text: A diabetic truck driver presents to you with cough and breathlessness. A diagnosis of pneumonia was confirmed, and histopathological examination revealed dichotomous branching, as shown below. What is the likely causative agent?

A patient from Uttar Pradesh presented with fever, pallor, and hepatosplenomegaly. Peripheral smear examination showed pancytopenia. Buffy coat examination showed macrophages laden with organisms with a kinetoplast. What is the vector for the likely disease?

A patient admitted with 50% burns develops an infection at the burn site. The swab was cultured, the isolate is a strict aerobe and the test that is shown in the image is positive. What is the likely etiology of the burn infection?

An unimmunized 2-year old child presented with coryza, conjunctivitis, and bluish-white spots in his buccal mucosa near the lower molar teeth. A day later, he developed a maculopapular rash on the face and neck. What is the nature of the causative virus?

A group of 20 friends kept partying till late at night. Two of them ate pastries from outside. They present with nausea and vomiting in the early morning. What is the most likely causative agent implicated?
A 3-year old child presents with fever, loose stools, and blood in the stool. What is the enrichment medium used to isolate the organism from the stool sample?

A truck driver came with complaints of a painless indurated genital ulcer after unsafe intercourse. Motility of the most likely causative organism can be detected by which of the following microscopes?
Which of the following disease is not transmitted by the vector shown below ?
Patient came in OPD with complaints of pain in the genital area. On examination there was a painful vesicle, associated with painful LAP, Diagnosis ?
Which of the following virus does need reverse transcription for PCR?
HIV genome needs which of the following to enter the membrane?
Patient recovered from Covid-19, given steroids, 3 weeks complaints of nasal discharge. Histopathological image given ?
Which bacterial toxin acts by interfering with EF-2 function ?
Patient presented with nasal bleeding and on examination shows nasal polys. Excision was done and histopathology is shown below. Diagnosis ?
Identify the organism and staining
A carpenter presents with a nodule on dorsum of hand which ulcerates after few days and has not healed for last 2 months. Biopsy of lesion was performed and shown below. Diagnosis is:
Organism showing movement transcellularly by ACTIN FILAMENTS ?

In the case of an elderly male presenting with meningitis, a gram stain of the CSF sample shows the presence of gram-positive bacilli. Which of the following statements accurately pertains to the motility of the responsible microorganism?
questions.correct_answer: C. Motile at 25° C, non-motile at 37°C

questions.text: An elderly male patient who received a kidney transplant a decade ago is presently under immunosuppressive treatment. He reports experiencing a persistent cough and shortness of breath over the past week. Microscopic examination of his sputum reveals the presence of gram-positive budding yeast cells and pseudohyphae. What is the probable diagnosis in this case?

options.label: D
options.text: Information is not enough for the diagnosis

questions.text: The transmission of infection during the perinatal period exhibits a range of symptoms, including anemia, potential myocarditis, high-output cardiac failure, and ascites. Identify the specific causative agent responsible for these manifestations.

A patient presented with a prolonged fever of unknown origin (PUO), raising suspicion of brucellosis. To confirm the diagnosis, various dilutions of the patient's serum sample are prepared for a standard agglutination test. The outcome is as follows: No agglutination is observed at serum dilutions of 1:20 and 1:40, while positive agglutination occurs at dilutions of 1:80 and 1:160. What factor is accountable for the lack of agglutination in the initial two dilutions?
The image below shows the life cycle of a virus. Which of the proteins of the virus act as oncogenes?
Image of Rickettsial morula in a monocyte is shown below. Identify the organism?
Delayed hypersensitivity is due to?
Identify the pathognomonic structure in the slide given below?
Which of the following is wrong regarding primary and secondary immune response?
Which of the following statements regarding the given image is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Albendazole is the drug of choice

options.label: B
options.text: Majority of infections are asymptomatic in humans

options.label: C
options.text: Infection is acquired by ingestion of aquatic plants

questions.correct_answer: B. Majority of infections are asymptomatic in humans

questions.text: Which of the following viruses exhibits genetic re-assortment similar to that of influenza virus?
Which of the following are acid-fast staining organisms? 1. Nocardia 2. Mycobacterium leprae 3. Actinomyces 4. Cryptosporidium parvum 5. Isospora belli
The cell wall depicted below is most likely to belong to which of the following organisms?
A microbiologist stained a tissue sample and found thin, filamentous bacteria, which resembled Nocardia sp. What other staining technique should be done to confirm the presence of Nocardia?
Which pathogen causes attachment-effacement lesion in the intestinal mucosa?
Identify the component responsible for endotoxic shock in gram-negative bacteria?
All are true about the bacteria shown below except:
A 24-year-old male patient presented to the outpatient department with cervical lymphadenopathy. As a part of the evaluation, the Paul-Bunnell test was done. What is the principle of this test?
Match the following eggs to the organism?
Identify the organism shown in this image?

A 32-year-old laborer working at a construction site presented with fever and hemoptysis. The sputum sample collected for examination showed the following. The smear will be stained by which of the following sequences?

options.label: B
options.text: Methylene blue - malachite green- acetic acid-water

questions.correct_answer: D. Carbol fuschin - acid-alcohol - methylene blue
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Carbol fuschin - acid-alcohol - methylene blue

questions.text: A 45-year-old man developed generalized muscle spasm with arching of his back as shown in the image, a few days after sustaining a puncture wound to his leg. The toxin responsible for this type of abnormal posturing acts by which of the following mechanisms?

options.label: A
options.text: Presynaptic inhibition of GABA and glycine release

options.label: D
options.text: Cleavage of SNARE proteins, preventing Ach release

questions.correct_answer: A. Presynaptic inhibition of GABA and glycine release

questions.text: A man with FUO has a job that requires traveling around the world. The bone marrow picture is shown below. Which of the following investigation would be the most appropriate in this case?
Which bacteria marked as X is responsible for the pattern shown here in the culture plate?
A patient presented with case of diarrhea after eating sea food/oysters, showing Kanagawa phenomenon? What is the causative organism?
The given image shows:
Acute hepatitis B is characterized by:
What is the following pattern seen with clostridium perfringens called?

A 2-year-old child presents with fever for 5 days and fast breathing. On examination breath sounds are reduced in left infra-axillary areas and left inframammary areas. CXR was performed and pleural tap was done. Gram stain of pus drained in pleural tap shows:
A Patient is infected with a dimorphic fungus which involves the subcutaneous layers, identify the organism responsible for it?
An 8-year-old child is presented with swelling on face and scrotum. Which of the following is causative agent?

A patient present with multiple episodes or bloody diarrhea. On investigation of blood sample Enterohemorrhagic strain of E. Coli was isolated. On which of the following media this organism can be cultured?

A patient presented with multiple asymptomatic scaly patches varying in color from white to tan to brown to pink. On potassium hydroxide wet mount spaghetti and meat ball appearance is seen. Which of the following is causative organism for this disease?
Gram positive alpha hemolytic cocci with catalase negative and optochin resistant causing endocarditis?
Soiled Cotton swabs are discarded in which bin?
Rh-ve mother had Rh+ve child. This Rh incompatibility is which type of hypersensitivity reaction?
Choice of drug for management of the parasitic infection shown below is:
A child is infected with a negative sense RNA virus which also contains neuraminidase receptors. What is the causative organism?
Which of the following organisms is not amenable to growth on standard artificial culture media?
Which of the following statements is true regarding antigenic drift?

options.label: A
options.text: There is a gradual sequential change in antigenic structure

options.label: B
options.text: It doesn't account for the periodic epidemics of influenza

options.label: C
options.text: New antigens thus formed are totally unrelated to the previous antigens

options.label: D
options.text: Antigens to the predecessor viruses do not neutralize the new variants

questions.correct_answer: A. There is a gradual sequential change in antigenic structure
questions.explanation: Ans. A) There is a gradual sequential change in antigenic structure
